result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gilbert Montrell Carothers

records.addlTxt:
Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Gilbert Montrell Carothers appeared. Case called at 15CM310, 15CM618. ADA Kelly updates the court. Atty. Caton agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 in 15CM618. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CM618. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM618 and read in and dismiss 15CM310 for purposes of restitution. Sentencing arguments. DE makes a statement. Crt orders: 
On 15CM618 -Sentence I/S 90 Days St. Croix County Jail. Court authorizes huber.
1 year probation with conditions: 
Probation can be terminiated earlier if DE satisfies all of his conditions of his bond and with a recommendation by agent. 
1 day credit against any ultimate sentence probation to run concurrent to current probation. 
- AODA and any recommended follow through. 
- 40 hours community service
- pay restitution on case 15CM310 of $135.84. 
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K.VanSomeren Thorton.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- DE to complete a victim impact panel
- Costs
- DE to make responable efforts to obtain GED or HSED. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

On 15CM310
- restitution of $135.84.
 
DE to report to probation by 9:00am on 02-24-2016.
Bond continues in form and amount until DE reports to probation.
Per TCH 1/28/16 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Status conference at 02-16-2016 03:00 pm

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kayla V.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
